body:

I feel like I was not properly warned about these two CUTIES and FEELINGS

summary: So I saw Good Omens and I really enjoyed it, and I might have to rebagel some Good Omens content on this blog, even tho it’s not...
body:
So I saw Good Omens and I really enjoyed it, and I might have to rebagel some Good Omens content on this blog, even tho it’s not VC. I’m not going to be general or specific about it bc spoilers.

If you have read the books and not seen the show: I haven’t read the book, but ppl who have read the book and seen the show tell me that they also enjoyed the adaptation, that it was faithful in many ways to canon.

Oh! Also, I would like some Good Omens/VC crossover fanart, if anyone wants to do any… *nudges*

tags: come yell with me about this show im like full of LOVE ABOUT IT
summary: Just finished Good Omens this morning thanks to a follower of mine loaning me their prime login (I don’t wanna put you on the...
body:
Just finished Good Omens this morning thanks to a follower of mine loaning me their prime login (I don’t wanna put you on the spot by @ing you but I love you and owe you my life) and all I have to say is I love this fresher, brighter take on the apocalypse from what Supernatural serves and also I love my Best Boys Aziraphale and Crowley with all my heart?? They’re so delightful?? AGH

also Aziraphale rebelling against the Great Plan for the Apocalypse stabbed me right in my soft spot for Castiel I’m just emotional

summary: I was in my twenties when this book was released... Copy you see here is from 1992, I believe... Anyway, watched the series and...
body: I was in my twenties when this book was released… Copy you see here is from 1992, I believe… Anyway, watched the series and WOW it hit me like a freight train! Simmering, shimmering delight… Well done by cast, crew, and @neil-gaiman. Made my week… Quite possibly my year. Thank you, it is a delight.

blog.name: aroziraphale
blog.title: prev. arofili
blog.description: anna ☆ 19 ☆ pnw ☆ they/them ☆ tolkien + personal ☆ hopeless aromantic ☆ follow for more soft pastel legolas ☆ if you respond to something i wrote and want me to see it, please @ me or you'll get lost in my notifs! ☆ ao3: starlightwalking (pls read my fic)

summary: Also, re: new url—do you have any thoughts on aspec Aziraphale (and/or Crowley)?
question: Also, re: new url—do you have any thoughts on aspec Aziraphale (and/or Crowley)?
answer:
1. they are,

….ok but Um Really, i just. the line between me projecting on my favorite characters and my actual analysis of their character arcs is very fine, so, uhhh

but for real like. i don’t think either of them actively id as aro/ace/aspec or whatever because like, human labels and all that. but i do think they can very easily fit into the definitions. these two idiots are very painfully in love and i love that,, so much,, but the nature of their love is very much Ineffable! it doesn’t fit the way we humans understand it, it just is and it’s transcendental and defining and that means a lot to me,

much in the same way gender doesn’t apply to them, romance and sex also don’t apply (wow catch me projecting again)… whatever is between them is built on a foundation of deep, intense friendship that neither of them want to admit. and goddamnit if that isn’t exactly my shit. like, my main “ship” is gigolas, yall !!!

some good posts on this: one, two, three, four (and five just because i love this post and interpreting it queerplatonically brings me such joy)

tags: I stand by my headcanon about Satan!lock impregnating Molly Hooper
summary: Sooooo...binge watched Good Omens. And it was glorious. Here are some of my random thoughts on it:  I love Crowley and...
body:
Sooooo…binge watched Good Omens.

And it was glorious.

Here are some of my random thoughts on it:

I love Crowley and Aziraphale. Equally. Usually I find one of the protagonists more annoying than the other, but I love them both. And they love each other. Hell, I don’t ship M/M ships and even I know these two are in love.

Although I dunno if I love Crowley/Aziraphale more or Crowley/Bentley more…?

And literally, the bureaucrats from up there and down there are a bunch of shitheads and assholes. It kinda reflects real life actually, they don’t really care how it’s done just as long it is done. But if shit goes down, all you angels and demons are going to get shit for it (trust me, this currently is happening to me and I work for a corporation)

BTW, this is probably the best role I have seen Jon Hamm in ever! EVER! Even more than in Baby Driver.

I also think the whole thing with the Holy Water that Crowley did was glorious. 

Speaking of Holy Water, the moment that did it for me to realize that Aziraphale loves his demon counterpart, was that he would say no to giving him the said liquid, but when it involves the other trying something dangerous just to get it…he hands it to him personally. In a plaid flask. Jebus where on Earth did they find that flask?!!!

And the voicemail. That was rad.

Also as a foodie, I love the little commentary on food fads.

And that bit on Hamlet, after I read about the story behind that scene, utter genius.

Also the bit on the M25…demonic genius baby


I think the only character I did not like was Shadwell….I hated how he was always calling Madame Tracey Jezebel. And also Pepper…I found her annoying.

And then the Sherlockian in me had the following thoughts

I already said I was definitely amused when I found out Sian Brooke was playing the adopted Mum of the spawn of Satan, with Satan being voiced by Cumberbatch. So Eurus is raising Sherlock’s son as her own…

(psst…I think by now everyone knows that my headcanon since we did not see how Adam was created, that he was the product of these two during a torridly hot affair:

again, this is just something that goes on in my head and not CANON, so don’t point it out if you don’t agree. And Lucifer in his human for looks much hotter than he appears in the airfield.)

And then that ridiculously long and epic cold open…I literally yelled out “Mycroft, is that you?”

Does no one else find that the Holmes kids are all in this a little amusing? (I guess I am the only weirdo then…)

But I think in the end, this story was about how in humanity there is no absolute and certainly no real sides, and certainly about those two becoming…well, human. 

Gosh David Tennant and Michael Sheen are such awesome actors, they can play each other~~~

There is a little bit of you in a little bit of me.

Speaking of Holy Water, the moment that did it for me to realize that Aziraphale loves his demon counterpart, was that he would say no to giving him the said liquid, but when it involves the other trying something dangerous just to get it…he hands it to him personally. again, this is just something that goes on in my head and not CANON, so don’t point it out if you don’t agree. And Lucifer in his human for looks much hotter than he appears in the airfield.)

And then that ridiculously long and epic cold open…I literally yelled out “Mycroft, is that you?”

Does no one else find that the Holmes kids are all in this a little amusing? (I guess I am the only weirdo then…)

But I think in the end, this story was about how in humanity there is no absolute and certainly no real sides, and certainly about those two becoming…well, human. 

Gosh David Tennant and Michael Sheen are such awesome actors, they can play each other~~~

There is a little bit of you in a little bit of me.

And then the Sherlockian in me had the following thoughts

I already said I was definitely amused when I found out Sian Brooke was playing the adopted Mum of the spawn of Satan, with Satan being voiced by Cumberbatch. So Eurus is raising Sherlock’s son as her own…

(psst…I think by now everyone knows that my headcanon since we did not see how Adam was created, that he was the product of these two during a torridly hot affair:

again, this is just something that goes on in my head and not CANON, so don’t point it out if you don’t agree. And Lucifer in his human for looks much hotter than he appears in the airfield.)

And then that ridiculously long and epic cold open…I literally yelled out “Mycroft, is that you?”

Does no one else find that the Holmes kids are all in this a little amusing? (I guess I am the only weirdo then…)

But I think in the end, this story was about how in humanity there is no absolute and certainly no real sides, and certainly about those two becoming…well, human. 

Gosh David Tennant and Michael Sheen are such awesome actors, they can play each other~~~

There is a little bit of you in a little bit of me.
trail.content_abstract:
Sooooo…binge watched Good Omens.

And it was glorious.

Here are some of my random thoughts on it:

I love Crowley and Aziraphale. Equally. Usually I find one of the protagonists more annoying than the other, but I love them both. And they love each other. Hell, I don’t ship M/M ships and even I know these two are in love.

Although I dunno if I love Crowley/Aziraphale more or Crowley/Bentley more…?

And literally, the bureaucrats from up there and down there are a bunch of shitheads and assholes. It kinda reflects real life actually, they don’t really care how it’s done just as long it is done. But if shit goes down, all you angels and demons are going to get shit for it (trust me, this currently is happening to me and I work for a corporation)

BTW, this is probably the best role I have seen Jon Hamm in ever! EVER! Even more than in Baby Driver.

I also think the whole thing with the Holy Water that Crowley did was glorious.

blog.name: sixstepsaway
blog.title: There's No Such Thing As Wasted Words
blog.description:
26 • Queer • Poly • You can call me Sophie or Jessica

I'm a writer and artist. I'm also pro-shipping, pro-fandom, pro-queer, pro-kink, anti-terf, anti-swerf and anti-censorship.

This blog is as much fandom nonsense as it is writerly nonsense, because it's impossible to divorce my love of TV and media from my being a writer. If that's not your thing, that's fine! I'm a multishipper.

In case you didn't know, I have a rather comprehensive navigation page with all kinds of things tagged

I also do Freelance Editing, if you're interested in that.
